From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

> Deathifier
> - Who hopes he won't get in trouble for posting it when the wish 
list
> conversation is two parts beyond the new editor :)

Only limitations I request is we don't deal with part 4 yet at this 
point: what we would love to see Gladiator:Beoyond Freedom do.  Beyond 
that, talk about Parts 1-3 is encouraged.

The point of multiple parts is to keep discussion going at a steady 
pace [If it was just one giant wish list for everything, conversation 
probably would have died out by now].  When I switch to a higher part 
number, it means that I thought conversation about the current part 
was almost dead and I attempted to keep the mailing list active again 
by starting the next part.  So far, my strategy has been working for 
bringing this mailing list to a more active state.  In fact, we have 
surpassed previous records for number posts in a month at yahoo.  
Frankly, I hope discussion about part 4 will drag on and on and on and 
on and on and on and on and on and on and on and on and on . . .

I do have a new topic planned for what happens when part 4 is 
exhausted.  Just don't ask me what comes after that topic because 
frankly, after that topic, I will be out of ideas except to recycle 
previous topics unless the tournament falls through.  BTW, if someone 
wants to bring something else up, feel free.  My goal is to keep this 
list somewhat active.

Also a reminder:  15 people need to show interest in a tournament 
before I will start work on that.  I have asked Tom Ricket to put 
something on the FSGames website about a possible tournament.

One more requested feature:

Search and replace objects.  Sometimes, I decide my opponents are 
either too weak or too strong and it would be very convient if I do a 
quick update on experience levels without having to delete lots of 
characters.
